intro: Spilanthes ocymifolia, commonly known as the "cow-calf plant," is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Spilanthes ocymifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
